newsitem.title: USA: America Online putting sports in cyberspace for ABC.
newsitem.headline: America Online putting sports in cyberspace for ABC.

text.p: America Online Inc. said Thursday the world's No. 1 online service will produce an ABC Sports section on its Sports Channel.
America Online said the agreement further expands its relationship with Walt Disney Co. unit ABC, which earlier this year agreed to provide an ABC News section on America Online.

Dulles, Va.-based America Online said the ABC Sports area will give subscribers exclusive online access to ABC coverage of major sporting events while offering both companies sponsorship and advertising opportunities.
The companies will work together to create broadcast and online advertising packages.
The online service is the largest in the world with about 8 million members.
Although the content for the site is still being developed, potential programming includes not only continually updated statistics and commentary during an event, but instant online polls.
America Online stock was unchanged at $50.25, while Disney rose 75 cents to $81.25, both on the New York Stock Exchange.
